glosses: very difficult, tough, meant to trip up; tricky

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قازیق or قازق (kazık), from Proto-Turkic *kaŕguk or *kaŕŋuk (“pole, stake”), from *kaŕ- or *kaŕın- (“to tie an animal to a firm place”) with the suffix *-(g)uk, morphologically kaz- + -ık.
Cognates
Azerbaijani qazıx
Bashkir ҡаҙаҡ (qaźaq)
Crimean Tatar къазыкъ, qazıq
Karaim казык
Karakhanid قَزُنكُقْ (qazñğuq, qazuñuq)
Kazakh қазық (qazyq)
Kumyk къазыкъ (qazıq)
Kyrgyz казык (kazık)
Nogai казык (kazık)
Southern Altai казык (kazïk)
Tatar кадак (qadaq), казык (qazıq), qazıq
Turkmen gazyk
Uyghur قوزۇق (qozuq)
Uzbek qoziq
